item.title: Enlightenment May Contest Winners!
item.description:
Earlier this year I was approached by our guild banker, Burbridge, and he made a request of me. He asked me to think up another competition, similar to our Christmas Essay competition and provided me with first place prize incentive that required something from our guild members that would challenge them.
The idea I came up with was a comic strip. Unfortunately, we did not get three team entries, but we did receive two team entries. The rules were simple: Three guildmembers were to form a team and together create a comic strip that highlighted a moment or moments in our guild.
Now we would like to share them with the rest of you.

item.title: Your long year..
item.description: Your long year ran right by here, just another short day to me.So how have you been in your beautiful skin?Did you solve all life's mysteries?In your long year..

item.title: The Performer(s)
item.description: One would think that when you are in a room beautifully decorated and surrounded by friends of all sizes and shapes that you would feel relaxed, peaceful, full of contentedness. Not so in the Demi-Plane of Blood!

item.title: Overlord Mata Muram-tales
item.description: Bonkr McDuck was an interesting ol’ duck.

item.title: The History of Ainmer the Bixie
item.description:
WARNING: AINMER ALERT
It’s common knowledge that one of the secrets behind Enlightenment’s success is our use of Teamspeak as a raid tool. While it can be disruptive at times – for the majority of the time it’s effectiveness is, by far, a major asset, especially when one considers the times we simply did not “have the numbers” to pull an encounter off, but did so regardless.
